main event: On February 6, 1959, an unidentified flying object was observed over the city of Boulder, Colorado. The object was described as a brilliant white light, approximately 10 to 15 feet in diameter, hovering at an estimated altitude of 3000 to 5000 feet above Boulder, and was observed by several individuals.
interesting points: The object was reported to have suddenly increased in size and then diminished, with the cycle repeating several times.
The sighting was reported to the Air Defense Command Control Center, the Colorado Civil Defense, and the Commander, 14th Air Division.
The object was observed by Deputy Sheriff H. L. Garner, the Boulder County Undersheriff, and an unidentified private pilot.
The Air Force investigation determined the object to be a natural meteorological phenomenon, possibly a lenticular cloud formation.
The case was classified as 'Unidentified' due to insufficient data to positively identify the object.
witnesses: Deputy Sheriff, Undersheriff, and an unidentified private pilot
